title: Experiencing packet loss
body: Hey i recently tried playing league and noticed i have been having extreme packet loss issues after i did a scan i dont know what to do i have it go through my fire wall and am running it as administration but to no avail, i have this problem on and off and would like to see it resolved for good. I went about to seasons without it but now it impedes my play thanks for the help.

replies.body:
Please follow the steps (if there are any you haven't completed) on the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure your connection is set up properly.

If those steps don't help, you can view your connection by running a traceroute, and sharing the results might show us where it's going wrong. I suggest downloading the [WinMTR Network Diagnostic Tool](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/), then use that to run a traceroute to the following IP (allow this to run for 5-15 minutes);

> 104.160.131.1

Export the results to a text file and paste them here if you'd like us to help, or submit them in a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pE8Ej5YR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-24T04:23:38.607+0000)
>
> Please follow the steps (if there are any you haven't completed) on the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure your connection is set up properly.
> 
> If those steps don't help, you can view your connection by running a traceroute, and sharing the results might show us where it's going wrong. I suggest downloading the [WinMTR Network Diagnostic Tool](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/), then use that to run a traceroute to the following IP (allow this to run for 5-15 minutes);

You're getting very high lag spikes immediately on your side (but not packet loss). Make sure there is nothing downloading in the background, and nobody doing so on your network. Automatic updates through Windows or apps like Steam can be scheduled or disabled to be done manually, and is a common culprit for this.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pE8Ej5YR,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-24T06:18:38.879+0000)
>
> You're getting very high lag spikes immediately on your side (but not packet loss). Make sure there is nothing downloading in the background, and nobody doing so on your network. Automatic updates through Windows or apps like Steam can be scheduled or disabled to be done manually, and is a common culprit for this.

would you recommend any other action may be i am missing something id like to be able to play but this problem seems to be alarming consistent now adays

The only thing I can think of is to try resetting your modem and router (cut power for a few minutes), and if that doesn't help to contact your ISP for assistance. The Rioter Porocles will likely go through these threads in the morning and he may have additional insight.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pE8Ej5YR,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-24T07:21:04.022+0000)
>
> The only thing I can think of is to try resetting your modem and router (cut power for a few minutes), and if that doesn't help to contact your ISP for assistance. The Rioter Porocles will likely go through these threads in the morning and he may have additional insight.

well thanks for trying but i have tried all the things you mentioned before and more but it hasent resolved my issue.  It seems odd this issue has been on and off during my time playing this game over the years and i havet changed anything that should effect it,

Is your internet delivered wirelessly (not the router to your computer, I mean from your ISP to your house)? Some connections may be inherently unstable. You can try plugging directly into your modem (bypassing any router), testing from a different computer, or of course the annoying option of calling your ISP for help. If you have a different connection available, such as internet sharing from your phone, you can try that to rule out the connection itself.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pE8Ej5YR,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-24T07:49:34.010+0000)
>
> Is your internet delivered wirelessly (not the router to your computer, I mean from your ISP to your house)? Some connections may be inherently unstable. You can try plugging directly into your modem (bypassing any router), testing from a different computer, or of course the annoying option of calling your ISP for help. If you have a different connection available, such as internet sharing from your phone, you can try that to rule out the connection itself.

im fairly sure our internet it wired we live in a fairly old house but that was installed not too long ago, i just cant seem to get my connection to stabilize like it used to be and it baffles me is all and playing games it now a gamble as to whether i can commit to actually connecting let alone trying to play. :/

Deep Terror Nami has been very thorough in the information they've offered you so far. Considering the latency to your own modem is pretty high, I'm wondering if you're connected to your network via WiFi. If this is the cause, you may see a change in your connection by bypassing your router entirely and trying a wired (ethernet) connection directly to your modem. 

Let me know if this causes any change for your connection.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pE8Ej5YR,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-07-24T17:12:20.568+0000)
>
> Deep Terror Nami has been very thorough in the information they've offered you so far. Considering the latency to your own modem is pretty high, I'm wondering if you're connected to your network via WiFi. If this is the cause, you may see a change in your connection by bypassing your router entirely and trying a wired (ethernet) connection directly to your modem. 
> 
> Let me know if this causes any change for your connection.

ill attempt this i have been meaning to set it up but the router is a fair distant from where i frequently playing. if this improves connection ill let you know but it seems as if the connection issue has been varying with patches.

I ran another test not too long ago however i cant seem to find it and it insisted that i had latency issues when playing league it was from the riot page, also there are no downloads occurring actually im the only one on at the moment. My latency issues only occur when i enter league matches and its oddly consistent nothings downloading and i rarely open steam i have it turned off till i actually wish to use it.
